title: Set PolyMC Minecraft niceness to -10 via wrapper
context: Configured Ubuntu 24.04 KDE Neon system so that Minecraft launched via PolyMC always runs with higher CPU scheduling priority.
keyIdea: Instead of globally editing PATH, a custom Java wrapper script was created and set in PolyMC’s Java runtime path. This ensures Minecraft’s Java process always starts with nice -10, improving performance without affecting other programs.
commands:
mkdir -p ~/.local/bin
nano ~/.local/bin/java-mc
# Paste wrapper content
#!/bin/bash
exec nice -n -10 /usr/lib/jvm/java-25-openjdk-amd64/bin/java "$@"
chmod +x ~/.local/bin/java-mc
# Then in PolyMC settings, set Java runtime path to this wrapper
explanation: PolyMC launches Minecraft via a specified Java executable. By replacing this with a wrapper that calls the real Java binary under a higher priority (nice -10), we gain finer control without changing system-wide PATH or affecting other applications.

reusabilityNotes.whenToReuse: When you want to raise process priority for a specific app launched through a runtime manager.
reusabilityNotes.pitfalls: Ensure the wrapper path is executable and PolyMC points to it. Avoid using -20 without proper permissions; -10 is safe for users.
